member.name: M:System.Compiler.GlobalAssemblyCache.Contains(System.Uri)
member.param: Uri pointing to the assembly

member.name: M:System.Compiler.GlobalAssemblyCache.GetLocation(System.Compiler.AssemblyReference)
member.summary: Returns the original location of the corresponding assembly if available, otherwise returns the location of the shadow copy. If the corresponding assembly is not in the GAC, null is returned.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Duplicator
member.summary: Walks an IR, duplicating it while fixing up self references to point to the duplicate IR. Only good for one duplication. Largest unit of duplication is a single module.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.StandardVisitor
member.summary: Walks an IR, mutuating it into a new form

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Visitor
member.summary: Base for all classes that process the IR using the visitor pattern.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Visitor.Visit(System.Compiler.Node)
member.summary: Switches on node.NodeType to call a visitor method that has been specialized for node.
member.param: The node to be visited.
member.returns: Returns null if node is null. Otherwise returns an updated node (possibly a different object).

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Visitor.TransferStateTo(System.Compiler.Visitor)
member.summary: Transfers the state from one visitor to another. This enables separate visitor instances to cooperative process a single IR.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.StandardVisitor.GetTypeView(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Return the current scope's view of the argument type, by asking the current scope's type viewer.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.StandardVisitor.TypeViewer
member.summary: Return a type viewer for the current scope. [The type viewer acts like the identity function, except for dialects (e.g. Extensible Sing#) that allow extensions and differing views of types.] null can be returned to represent an identity-function type viewer.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Duplicator.#ctor(System.Compiler.Module,System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.param: The module into which the duplicate IR will be grafted.
The type into which the duplicate Member will be grafted. Ignored if entire type, or larger unit is duplicated.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Duplicator.#ctor(System.Compiler.Module,System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Int32)
member.param: The module into which the duplicate IR will be grafted.
The type into which the duplicate Member will be grafted. Ignored if entire type, or larger unit is duplicated.
initial capacity of dup forwarding table. Default 4

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Duplicator.VisitMethodInternal(System.Compiler.Method)
member.summary: Does not copy the method's template parameters unless they are marked for duplication already.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.BinaryWriter
member.summary: High performance replacement for System.IO.BinaryWriter.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.BetterPath
member.summary: A version of System.IO.Path that does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.MemberList.Remove(System.Compiler.Member)
member.summary: Removes member (by nulling slot) if present

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Metadata.MemoryMappedFile
member.summary: Public only for use by the Framework. Do not use this class. Well, if you really really must, use it only if you can tolerate keeping the file locked for at least as long as any Identifier derived from the file stays alive.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.ISourceText
member.summary: This interface can be used to link an arbitrary source text provider into an IR tree via a DocumentText instance.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.ISourceText.Substring(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a substring from this instance. The substring starts with the character at the specified index and has a specified length.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.ISourceText.MakeCollectible
member.summary: Indicates that the text has been fully scanned and futher references to the text are expected to be infrequent. The underlying object can now choose to clear cached information if it comes under resource pressure.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.ISourceText.Length
member.summary: The number of characters in the source text. A "character" corresponds to a System.Char which is actually a Unicode UTF16 code point to be precise.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.ISourceText.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the character at the given position. The first character is at position zero.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.ISourceTextBuffer.Buffer
member.summary: Returns null unless the implementer is based on an ASCII buffer that stays alive as long at the implementer itself. An implementer that returns a non-null value is merely a wrapper to keep the buffer alive. No further methods will be called on the interface in this case.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.CollectibleSourceText
member.summary: Use this after a source text has already been scanned and parsed. This allows the source text to get released if there is memory pressure, while still allowing portions of it to be retrieved on demand. This is useful when a large number of source files are read in, but only infrequent references are made to them.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.StringSourceText
member.summary: This class is used to wrap the string contents of a source file with an ISourceText interface. It is used while compiling a project the first time in order to obtain a symbol table. After that the StringSourceText instance is typically replaced with a CollectibleSourceText instance, so that the actual source text string can be collected. When a file is edited, and the editor does not provide its own ISourceText wrapper for its edit buffer, this class can be used to wrap a copy of the edit buffer.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.StringSourceText.SourceText
member.summary: The wrapped string used to implement ISourceText. Use this value when unwrapping.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.StringSourceText.IsSameAsFileContents
member.summary: True when the wrapped string is the contents of a file. Typically used to check if it safe to replace this StringSourceText instance with a CollectibleSourceText instance.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.DocumentText
member.summary: This class provides a uniform interface to program sources provided in the form of Unicode strings, unsafe pointers to ascii buffers (as obtained from a memory mapped file, for instance) as well as arbitrary source text providers that implement the ISourceText interface.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.DocumentText.AsciiStringPtr
member.summary: If this is not null it is used to obtain 8-bit ASCII characters.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.DocumentText.Source
member.summary: If this is not null it represents a Unicode string encoded as UTF16.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.DocumentText.TextProvider
member.summary: If this is not null the object implement ISourceText provides some way to get at individual characters and substrings.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.DocumentText.Length
member.summary: The number of characters in the source document. A "character" corresponds to a System.Char which is actually a Unicode UTF16 code point to be precise.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.DocumentText.Equals(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compare this.Substring(offset, length) for equality with str. Call this only if str.Length is known to be equal to length.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.DocumentText.Equals(System.Int32,System.Compiler.DocumentText,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compares the substring of the specificied length starting at offset, with the substring in DocumentText starting at textOffset.
member.param: The index of the first character of the substring of this DocumentText.
The Document text with the substring being compared to.
The index of the first character of the substring of the DocumentText being compared to.
The number of characters in the substring being compared.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.DocumentText.Substring(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a substring from this instance. The substring starts at a specified character position and has a specified length.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.DocumentText.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the character at the given position. The first character is at position zero.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Document
member.summary: A source document from which an Abstract Syntax Tree has been derived.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.DocumentType
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the kind of document to applications such as a debugger. Typically System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymDocumentType.Text.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.Language
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate language specific logic.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.LanguageVendor
member.summary: A Guid that identifies the compiler vendor programming language used in the source document. Typically used by a debugger to locate vendor specific logic.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.LineNumber
member.summary: The line number corresponding to the first character in Text. Typically 1 but can be changed by C# preprocessor directives.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.Hidden
member.summary: Indicates that the document contains machine generated source code that should not show up in tools such as debuggers. Can be set by C# preprocessor directives.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.Name
member.summary: The name of the document. Typically a file name. Can be a full or relative file path, or a URI or some other kind of identifier.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.Text
member.summary: Contains the source text.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.GetLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps the given zero based character position to the number of the source line containing the same character. Line number counting starts from the value of LineNumber.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.GetColumn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps the given zero based character position in the entire text to the position of the same character in a source line. Counting within the source line starts at 1.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.GetOffsets(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Given a startLine, startColum, endLine and endColumn, this returns the corresponding startPos and endPos. In other words it converts a range expression in line and columns to a range expressed as a start and end character position.
member.param: The number of the line containing the first character. The number of the first line equals this.LineNumber.
The position of the first character relative to the start of the line. Counting from 1.
The number of the line contain the character that immediate follows the last character of the range.
The position, in the last line, of the character that immediately follows the last character of the range.
The position in the entire text of the first character of the range, counting from 0.
The position in the entire text of the character following the last character of the range.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.Substring(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a substring from the text of this Document. The substring starts at a specified character position and has a specified length.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.GetLineCount(System.String)
member.summary: Counts the number of end of line marker sequences in the given text.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.lineOffsets
member.summary: An array of offsets, with offset at index i corresponding to the position of the first character of line i, (counting lines from 0).

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.lines
member.summary: The number of lines in Text.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.Search(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the index in this.lineOffsets array such that this.lineOffsets[index] is less than or equal to offset and offset is less than lineOffsets[index+1]

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.GetPosition(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Maps the given zero based character position in the entire text to a (line, column) pair corresponding to the same position. Counting within the source line starts at 0. Counting source lines start at 0.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.AddOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds the given offset to the this.lineOffsets table as the offset corresponding to the start of line this.lines+1.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Document.ComputeLineOffsets
member.summary: Populates this.lineOffsets with an array of offsets, with offset at index i corresponding to the position of the first character of line i, (counting lines from 0).

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Document.uniqueKeyCounter
member.summary: Add one to this every time a Document instance gets a unique key.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Document.UniqueKey
member.summary: An integer that uniquely distinguishes this document instance from every other document instance. This provides an efficient equality test to facilitate hashing.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.HiddenDocument
member.summary: Can be used to mark magic hidden source contexts that are ignored by debuggers and code coverage tools

member.name: T:System.Compiler.SourceContext
member.summary: Records a location within a source document that corresponds to an Abstract Syntax Tree node.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.SourceContext.Document
member.summary: The source document within which the AST node is located. Null if the node is not derived from a source document.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.SourceContext.EndPos
member.summary: The zero based index of the first character beyond the last character in the source document that corresponds to the AST node.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.SourceContext.StartPos
member.summary: The zero based index of the first character in the source document that corresponds to the AST node.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.SourceContext.Encloses(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the line and column is greater than or equal the position of the first character and less than or equal to the position of the last character of the source document that corresponds to the AST node.
member.param: A line number(counting from Document.LineNumber)
A column number (counting from one)

member.name: P:System.Compiler.SourceContext.StartLine
member.summary: The number (counting from Document.LineNumber) of the line containing the first character in the source document that corresponds to the AST node.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.SourceContext.StartColumn
member.summary: The number (counting from one) of the line column containing the first character in the source document that corresponds to the AST node.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.SourceContext.EndLine
member.summary: The number (counting from Document.LineNumber) of the line containing the first character beyond the last character in the source document that corresponds to the AST node.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.SourceContext.EndColumn
member.summary: The number (counting from one) of the line column containing first character beyond the last character in the source document that corresponds to the AST node.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.SourceContext.SourceText
member.summary: The substring of the source document that corresponds to the AST node.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.CompilerSite
member.summary: Allows a compilation to output progress messages and to query if cancellation was requested.

members.member: 0-: Common 1000-: HScript 2000-: EcmaScript 3000-: Zonnon 4000-: Comega 5000-: X++ 6000-: Spec# 7000-: Sing# 8000-: Xaml 9000-: C/AL For your range contact hermanv@microsoft.com

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Node
member.summary: A node in an Abstract Syntax Tree.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Node.Clone
member.summary: Makes a shallow copy of the node.
member.returns: A shallow copy of the node

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Node.SourceContext
member.summary: The region in the source code that contains the concrete syntax corresponding to this node in the Abstract Syntax Tree.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Node.NodeType
member.summary: A scalar tag that identifies the concrete type of the node. This is provided to allow efficient type membership tests that facilitate tree traversal.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Node.UniqueKey
member.summary: An integer that uniquely identifies this node. This provides an efficient equality test to facilitate hashing. Do not override this.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Literal
member.summary: This an Expression wrapper for compile time constants. It is assumed to be correct by construction. In Normalized IR, the wrapped value must be a primitive numeric type or an enum or a string or null. If used in custom attributes, types are also allowed as well as single dimensional arrays of other allowed types. If the wrapped value is null, any reference type is allowed, except in custom attributes, where it must be Type or String.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Literal.Value
member.summary: Holds the wrapped compile time constant value.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Variable.Name
member.summary: The name of a stack location. For example the name of a local variable or the name of a method parameter.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Parameter.GetParamArrayElementType
member.summary: If the parameter is a param array, this returns the element type of the array. If not, it returns null.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Parameter.GetAttribute(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Gets the first attribute of the given type in the attribute list of this parameter. Returns null if none found. This should not be called until the AST containing this member has been processed to replace symbolic references to members with references to the actual members.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Parameter.Attributes
member.summary: The (C# custom) attributes of this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Parameter.DefaultValue
member.summary: The value that should be supplied as the argument value of this optional parameter if the source code omits an explicit argument value.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Parameter.ParameterListIndex
member.summary: Zero based index into a parameter list containing this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Parameter.ArgumentListIndex
member.summary: Zero based index into the list of arguments on the evaluation stack. Instance methods have the this object as parameter zero, which means that the first parameter will have value 1, not 0.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Parameter.IsIn
member.summary: True if the corresponding argument value is used by the callee. (This need not be the case for a parameter marked as IsOut.)

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Parameter.IsOptional
member.summary: True if the caller can omit providing an argument for this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Parameter.IsOut
member.summary: True if the corresponding argument must be a left hand expression and will be updated when the call returns.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Identifier.Empty
member.summary: An identifier with the empty string ("") as its value.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Identifier.For(System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use when pointer+offset points to a null terminated string of UTF8 code points.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Identifier.For(System.Byte*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use when pointer points to a string of UTF8 code points of a given length

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Identifier.UniqueIdKey
member.summary: Returns an integer that is the same for every Identifier instance that has the same string value, and that is different from every other identifier instance that has a different string value. Useful for efficient equality tests when hashing identifiers.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Indexer.ElementType
member.summary: This type is normally expected to be the same the value of Type. However, if the indexer applies to an array of enums, then Type will be the enum type and ElementType will be the underlying type of the enum.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.LRExpression
member.summary: An expression that is used on the left hand as well as the right hand side of an assignment statement. For example, e in (e += 1).

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Instruction.OpCode
member.summary: The actual value of the opcode

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Instruction.Offset
member.summary: The offset from the start of the instruction stream of a method

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Instruction.Value
member.summary: Immediate data such as a string, the address of a branch target, or a metadata reference, such as a Field

member.name: F:System.Compiler.AssignmentStatement.UnifiedType
member.summary: A Type two which both operands must be coerced before carrying out the operation (if any).

member.name: T:System.Compiler.ReturnValue
member.summary: Represents the return value in a post condition

member.name: M:System.Compiler.AttributeNode.GetCoercedLiteralValue(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the value of the literal coercing literals of TypeNode, EnumNode, TypeNode[], and EnumNode[] as needed.
member.param: A TypeNode representing the type of the literal
The value of the literal
member.returns: An object that has been coerced to the appropiate runtime type

member.name: M:System.Compiler.AttributeNode.GetCoercedArrayLiteral(System.Compiler.ArrayType,System.Array)
member.summary: Gets the array literal in arrayValue coercing TypeNode[] and EnumNode[] as needed.
member.param: A TypeNode representing the array type
The value of the array literal to coerce
member.returns: An Array object that has been coerced to the appropriate runtime type

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AttributeNode.Expressions
member.summary: Invariant: positional arguments occur first and in order in the expression list. Named arguments follow posititional arguments in any order.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Module.DocumentationNode
member.summary: The source code, if any, corresponding to the value in Documentation.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Module.GetAttribute(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Gets the first attribute of the given type in the custom attribute list of this module. Returns null if none found. This should not be called until the module has been processed to replace symbolic references to members with references to the actual members.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Module.GetStructurallyEquivalentType(System.Compiler.Identifier,System.Compiler.Identifier)
member.summary: The identifier represents the structure via some mangling scheme. The result can be either from this module, or any module this module has a reference to.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: The assembly, if any, that includes this module in its ModuleReferences.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Kind
member.summary: An enumeration that indicates if the module is an executable, library or resource, and so on.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Location
member.summary: The path of the file from which this module or assembly was loaded or will be stored in.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.TargetRuntimeVersion
member.summary: Identifies the version of the CLR that is required to load this module or assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.ProjectTypesContainedInModule
member.summary: When true, then methods are projected based on the flags of their containing types. When false, then no projection happens (i.e., it overrides the type flags). Can be set by client, otherwise the default is that modules created from .winmd files are projected, all others are not projected.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Name
member.summary: The name of the module or assembly. Includes the file extension if the module is not an assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.MetadataImportErrors
member.summary: If any exceptions were encountered while reading in this module, they are recorded here. Since reading is lazy, this list can grow dynamically during the use of a module.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Attributes
member.summary: The attributes associated with this module or assembly. This corresponds to C# custom attributes with the assembly or module target specifier.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Declarative security for the module or assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Documentation
member.summary: An XML Document Object Model for a document containing all of the documentation comments applicable to members defined in this module.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.EntryPoint
member.summary: If this module is an executable, this method is the one that gets called to start the execution of managed code.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.ModuleReferences
member.summary: The list of modules (excluding assemblies) defining members that are referred to in this module or assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Resources
member.summary: A list of managed resources linked or embedded into this module or assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Win32Resources
member.summary: A list of Win32 resources embedded in this module or assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Module.Types
member.summary: The types contained in this module or assembly.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.GetModuleAttribute(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Gets the first attribute of the given type in the custom attribute list of this member. Returns null if none found. The member is assumed to be either imported, or already in a form suitable for export.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.GetAssembly(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.PostAssemblyLoadProcessor)
member.summary: Calls the post load event only if the assembly is not already loaded/found in the cache.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.ContractAssembly
member.summary: A separate assembly that supplied the type and method contracts for this assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.StrongName
member.summary: A string containing the name, version, culture and key of this assembly, formatted as required by the CLR loader.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.Culture
member.summary: The target culture of any localized resources in this assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.Flags
member.summary: An enumeration that identifies the what kind of assembly this is.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.ModuleName
member.summary: Attributes that specifically target a module rather an assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.PublicKeyOrToken
member.summary: The public part of the key pair used to sign this assembly, or a hash of the public key.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.Version
member.summary: The version of this assembly.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.ExportedTypes
member.summary: Public types defined in other modules making up this assembly and to which other assemblies may refer to.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.AssemblyNode.ModuleAttributes
member.summary: The attributes associated with this module. This corresponds to C# custom attributes with the module target specifier.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Member
member.summary: A member of a Namespace or a TypeNode

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Member.DeclaringNamespace
member.summary: The namespace of which this node is a member. Null if this node is a member of type.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Member.IsUnsafe
member.summary: Indicates that the signature of this member may include unsafe types such as pointers. For methods and properties, it also indicates that the code may contain unsafe constructions such as pointer arithmetic.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Member.References
member.summary: A list of other nodes that refer to this member. Must be filled in by client code.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Member.GetAttribute(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Gets the first attribute of the given type in the attribute list of this member. Returns null if none found. This should not be called until the AST containing this member has been processed to replace symbolic references to members with references to the actual members.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Member.DocumentationNode
member.summary: The source code, if any, corresponding to the value in Documentation.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Member.WriteDocumentation(System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Writes out an element with tag "element", name attribute DocumentationId.ToString() and body Documentation using the provided XmlTextWriter instance.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.DeclaringType
member.summary: The type of which this node is a member. Null if this node is a member of a Namespace.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.Name
member.summary: The unqualified name of the member.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.Attributes
member.summary: The attributes of this member. Corresponds to custom attribute annotations in C#.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.HidesBaseClassMember
member.summary: Indicates if this is a member of a subclass that intentionally has the same signature as a member of a base class. Corresponds to the "new" modifier in C#.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.OverridesBaseClassMember
member.summary: Indicates if this is a virtual method of a subclass that intentionally overrides a method of a base class. Corresponds to the "override" modifier in C#.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.FullName
member.summary: The concatenation of the FullName of the containing member and the name of this member. Separated with a '.' character if the containing member is a namespace and a '+' character if the containing member is a Type. Includes the parameter type full names when this member is a method or a property. Also includes (generic) template arguments.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsAssembly
member.summary: True if all references to this member must be from the assembly containing the definition of this member.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsCompilerControlled
member.summary: True if access to this member is controlled by the compiler and not the runtime. Cannot be accessed from other assemblies since these are not necessarily controlled by the same compiler.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsFamily
member.summary: True if this member can only be accessed from subclasses of the class declaring this member.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsFamilyAndAssembly
member.summary: True if this member can only be accessed from subclasses of the class declaring this member, provided that these subclasses are also contained in the assembly containing this member.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsFamilyOrAssembly
member.summary: True if all references to this member must either be from the assembly containing the definition of this member, or from a subclass of the class declaring this member.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsPrivate
member.summary: True if all references to this member must be from members of the type declaring this member.///

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsPublic
member.summary: True if the member can be accessed from anywhere.///

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the name of this member conforms to a naming pattern with special meaning. For example the name of a property getter.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsStatic
member.summary: True if this member always has the same value or behavior for all instances the declaring type.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.IsVisibleOutsideAssembly
member.summary: True if another assembly can contain a reference to this member.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.ObsoleteAttribute
member.summary: A cached reference to the first Obsolete attribute of this member. Null if no such attribute exsits.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.Documentation
member.summary: The body of an XML element containing a description of this member. Used to associated documentation (such as this comment) with members. The fragment usually conforms to the structure defined in the C# standard.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.DocumentationId
member.summary: The value of the name attribute of the XML element whose body is the XML fragment returned by Documentation.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Member.HelpText
member.summary: The value of the summary child element of the XML fragment returned by Documentation. All markup is stripped from the value.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.TypeNode
member.summary: The common base class for all types. This type should not be extended directly. Instead extend one of the standard subclasses such as Class, Struct or Interface, since in the CLR a type has to be an instance of one the subclasses, and a type which does not extend one of these types will have no equivalent in the CLR.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsDefinedBy
member.summary: If this type is the combined result of a number of partial type definitions, this lists the partial definitions.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsNotFullySpecialized
member.summary: True if this type is the result of a template instantiation with arguments that are themselves template parameters. Used to model template instantiations occurring inside templates.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.PartiallyDefines
member.summary: If this type is a partial definition, the value of this is the combined type resulting from all the partial definitions.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.extensions
member.summary: The list of extensions of this type, if it's a non-extension type. all extensions implement the IExtendTypeNode interface (in the Sing# code base). null = empty list

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.extensionsExamined
member.summary: Whether or not the list of extensions has been examined; it's a bug to record a new extension after extensions have been examined.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.RecordExtension(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Record another extension of this type.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.DuplicateExtensions(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNodeList)
member.summary: Copy a (possibly transformed) set of extensions from source to the receiver, including whether or not the extensions have been examined.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.op_Equality(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Return whether t1 represents the same type as t2 (or both are null). This copes with the cases where t1 and/or t2 may be type views and/or type extensions, as in Extensible Sing#.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ProvideTypeMembers
member.summary: A delegate that is called the first time Members is accessed, if non-null. Provides for incremental construction of the type node. Must not leave Members null.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ProvideNestedTypes
member.summary: A delegate that is called the first time NestedTypes is accessed, if non-null.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ProvideTypeAttributes
member.summary: A delegate that is called the first time Attributes is accessed, if non-null. Provides for incremental construction of the type node. Must not leave Attributes null.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ProvideTypeSignature
member.summary: A delegate that is called the first time BaseClass, Interfaces, or TemplateParameters, or DeclaringType are accessed, if non-null. Provides for incremental construction of the type node.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ProviderHandle
member.summary: Opaque information passed as a parameter to the delegates in ProvideTypeMembers et al. Typically used to associate this namespace instance with a helper object.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetAbstractMethods(System.Compiler.MethodList)
member.summary: Returns the methods of an abstract type that have been left unimplemented. Includes methods inherited from base classes and interfaces, and methods from any (known) extensions.
member.param: A method list to which the abstract methods must be appended.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetArrayType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a type representing an array whose elements are of this type. Will always return the same instance for the same rank.
member.param: The number of dimensions of the array.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetArrayType(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Returns a type representing an array whose elements are of this type. Will always return the same instance for the same rank, sizes and bounds.
member.param: The number of dimensions of the array.
The size of each dimension.
The lower bound for indices. Defaults to zero.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetConstructor(System.Compiler.TypeNode[])
member.summary: Returns the constructor with the specified parameter types. Returns null if this type has no such constructor.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetTemplateInstance(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNode[])
member.summary: Gets an instance for the given template arguments of this (generic) template type.
member.param: The type in which the reference to the template instance occurs. If the template is not generic, the instance becomes a nested type of the referring type so that it has the same access privileges as the code referrring to the instance.
The template arguments.
member.returns: An instance of the template. Always the same instance for the same arguments.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetTemplateInstance(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNodeList)
member.summary: Gets an instance for the given template arguments of this (generic) template type.
member.param: The type in which the reference to the template instance occurs. If the template is not generic, the instance becomes a nested type of the referring type so that it has the same access privileges as the code referrring to the instance.
The template arguments.
member.returns: An instance of the template. Always the same instance for the same arguments.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetMembersNamed(System.Compiler.Identifier)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the members declared directly by this type with the specified name. Returns an empty list if this type has no such members.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetEvent(System.Compiler.Identifier)
member.summary: Returns the first event declared by this type with the specified name. Returns null if this type has no such event.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetField(System.Compiler.Identifier)
member.summary: Returns the first field declared by this type with the specified name. Returns null if this type has no such field.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetMethod(System.Compiler.Identifier,System.Compiler.TypeNode[])
member.summary: Returns the first method declared by this type with the specified name and parameter types. Returns null if this type has no such method.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetNestedType(System.Compiler.Identifier)
member.summary: Returns the first nested type declared by this type with the specified name. Returns null if this type has no such nested type.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetProperty(System.Compiler.Identifier,System.Compiler.TypeNode[])
member.summary: Returns the first property declared by this type with the specified name and parameter types. Returns null if this type has no such property.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetTypeNode(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets a TypeNode instance corresponding to the given System.Type instance.
member.param: A runtime type.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.GetRuntimeType
member.summary: Gets a System.Type instance corresponding to this type. The assembly containin this type must be normalized and must have a location on disk or must have been loaded via AssemblyNode.GetRuntimeAssembly.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsAssignableTo(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Func{System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNode})
member.summary: Returns true if the CLR CTS allows a value of this type may be assigned to a variable of the target type (possibly after boxing), either because the target type is the same or a base type, or because the target type is an interface implemented by this type or the implementor of this type, or because this type and the target type are zero based single dimensional arrays with assignment compatible reference element types

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsAssignableToInstanceOf(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Returns true if this type is assignable to some instance of the given template.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsAssignableToInstanceOf(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNodeList@)
member.summary: Returns true if this type is assignable to some instance of the given template.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsDerivedFrom(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Returns true if otherType is the base class of this type or if the base class of this type is derived from otherType.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.DeepStripModifiers(System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNode,System.Compiler.TypeNode[])
member.summary: Strip the given modifier from the type, modulo substructures that are instantiated with respect to the given template type. In other words, travers type and templateType in parallel, stripping common non-null modifiers, but stop when reaching a type variable in the template type. Type to be stripped Modifiers to strip off Template bounding the stripping of type. Passing null for the templateType performs a full DeepStrip

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ClearMemberTable
member.summary: Needed whenever we change the id of an existing member

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.Contract
member.summary: The invariants and modelfield contracts associated with this type (for now only classes, interfaces, structs).

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ClassSize
member.summary: Specifies the total size in bytes of instances of types with prescribed layout.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.DeclaringModule
member.summary: The module or assembly to which the compiled type belongs.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.DeclaringType
member.summary: For TypeNode, DeclaringType is delay loaded based on the SignatureProvider. Use Interfaces to trigger

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.Interfaces
member.summary: The interfaces implemented by this class or struct, or the extended by this interface.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.Namespace
member.summary: The namespace to which this type belongs. Null if the type is nested inside another type.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.PackingSize
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of fields within types with prescribed layout.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.Extensions
member.summary: The property that should be accessed by clients to get the list of extensions of this type.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ExtensionsNoTouch
member.summary: When duplicating a type node, we want to transfer the extensions and the extensionsExamined flag without treating this as a "touch" that sets the examined flag. Pretty ugly, though.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.EffectiveTypeNode
member.summary: If the receiver is a type extension, return the extendee, otherwise return the receiver. [The identity function, except for dialects (e.g. Extensible Sing#) that allow extensions and differing views of types]

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Contains declarative security information associated with the type.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.BaseType
member.summary: The type from which this type is derived. Null in the case of interfaces and System.Object.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.DefaultMembers
member.summary: A list of any members of this type that have the DefaultMember attribute.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.ConstructorName
member.summary: Return the name the constructor should have in this type node. By default, it's the same as the name of the enclosing type node, but it can be different in e.g. extensions in Extensible Sing#

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the type is an abstract class or an interface.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if this type is a template conforming to the rules of a generic type in the CLR.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsNormalized
member.summary: True if the type node is in "normal" form. A node is in "normal" form if it is effectively a node in an AST formed directly from CLR module or assembly. Such a node can be written out as compiled code to an assembly or module without further processing.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsPrimitiveComparable
member.summary: True if values of this type can be compared directly in CLR IL instructions.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsPrimitiveInteger
member.summary: True if values of this type are integers that can be processed by CLR IL instructions.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsPrimitiveNumeric
member.summary: True if values of this type are integers or floating point numbers that can be processed by CLR IL instructions.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsPrimitiveUnsignedInteger
member.summary: True if values of this type are unsigned integers that can be processed by CLR IL instructions.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsPrimitive
member.summary: True if values of this type can be processed by CLR IL instructions.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the type cannot be derived from.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsStructural
member.summary: True if the identity of the type depends on its structure rather than its name. Arrays, pointers and generic type instances are examples of such types.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsTemplateParameter
member.summary: True if the type serves as a parameter to a type template.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the type is a value type containing only fields of unmanaged types.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.StructuralElementTypes
member.summary: A list of the types that contribute to the structure of a structural type.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsUnsignedPrimitiveNumeric
member.summary: True if values of this type are unsigned integers that can be processed by CLR IL instructions.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsValueType
member.summary: True if instances of this type have no identity other than their value and are copied upon assignment.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsReferenceType
member.summary: Returns true if the type is definitely a reference type.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.IsPointerType
member.summary: True if underlying type (modulo type modifiers) is a pointer type (Pointer)

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.Members
member.summary: The list of members contained inside this type, by default ignoring any extensions of this type. (Subclasses in the Extensible Sing# dialect override this to include members of visible extensions.) If the value of members is null and the value of ProvideTypeMembers is not null, the TypeMemberProvider delegate is called to fill in the value of this property.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.Template
member.summary: The (generic) type template from which this type was instantiated. Null if this is not a (generic) type template instance.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.TemplateArguments
member.summary: The arguments used when this (generic) type template instance was instantiated.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.TemplateParameters
member.summary: The type parameters of this type. Null if this type is not a (generic) type template.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeNode.TypeCode
member.summary: The System.TypeCode value that Convert.GetTypeCode will return pass an instance of this type as parameter.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.TypeNode.TypeMemberProvider
member.summary: The type of delegates that fill in the Members property of the given type.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.TypeNode.NestedTypeProvider
member.summary: The type of delegates that fill in the NestedTypes property of the given type.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.TypeNode.TypeAttributeProvider
member.summary: The type of delegates that fill in the Attributes property of the given type.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.TypeNode.TypeSignatureProvider
member.summary: The type of delegates that fill in the BaseClass,Interfaces, and TemplateParameters properties of the given type.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.TypeNode.TemplateInstanceCache.cache
member.summary: Sorted lexicographically by templateargument uniqueId

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Class.BaseClass
member.summary: The class from which this class has been derived. Null if this class is System.Object.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.EnumNode.UnderlyingType
member.summary: The underlying integer type used to store values of this enumeration.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Struct.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the type is a value type containing only fields of unmanaged types.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.ITypeParameter.ParameterListIndex
member.summary: Zero based index into a parameter list containing this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeParameter.ParameterListIndex
member.summary: Zero based index into a parameter list containing this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.TypeParameter.IsTemplateParameter
member.summary: True if the type serves as a parameter to a type template.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.ClassParameter.ParameterListIndex
member.summary: Zero based index into a parameter list containing this parameter.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.ClassParameter.IsTemplateParameter
member.summary: True if the type serves as a parameter to a type template.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.ArrayType.Interfaces
member.summary: The interfaces implemented by this class or struct, or the extended by this interface.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.OptionalModifierTypeExpression.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: Only needed because IsUnmanaged test is performed in the Looker rather than checker. Once the test is moved, this code can be removed.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.RequiredModifierTypeExpression.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: Can be removed once the Unmanaged check moves from Looker to Checker.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.PointerTypeExpression.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: This is only needed because the Unmanaged test is done in the Looker rather than the checker. (Once the check moves, this can be removed).

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Event.ImplementedTypes
member.summary: The list of types (just one in C#) that contain abstract or virtual events that are explicity implemented or overridden by this event.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Event.InitialHandler
member.summary: Provides a delegate instance that is added to the event upon initialization.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Event.Flags
member.summary: Bits characterizing this event.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Event.HandlerAdder
member.summary: The method to be called in order to add a handler to an event. Corresponds to the add clause of a C# event declaration.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Event.HandlerCaller
member.summary: The method that gets called to fire an event. There is no corresponding C# syntax.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Event.HandlerRemover
member.summary: The method to be called in order to remove a handler from an event. Corresponds to the remove clause of a C# event declaration.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Event.HandlerType
member.summary: The delegate type that a handler for this event must have. Corresponds to the type clause of C# event declaration.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Event.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the methods constituting this event are abstract.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Event.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if that the methods constituting this event are virtual.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.MethodContractElement.DefSite
member.summary: Set via contract abbreviations to point to the def site of the abbreviation. The regular context points to the use site.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.RequiresPlain.ExceptionType
member.summary: If non-null, indicates that this is a Requires<TException> form throwing TException

member.name: F:System.Compiler.RequiresOtherwise.ThrowException
member.summary: The ThrowException can be a type reference (like "NullReferenceException") or a value that would evaluate to something of an exception type. (like new NullReferenceException("...") or C.f where the f is a static field of class C whose type is an exception.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.MethodContract.contractInitializer
member.summary: Used when contract are extracted from code and the contract use delegates with closure objects. The contractInitializer block then contains the closure initialization and possibly other local initializations for delegate caches

member.name: F:System.Compiler.MethodContract.postPreamble
member.summary: For contracts of constructors with closures, the initialization of the closure field holding "this" is postponed until after the basector call. Post conditions may refer to this field in the contract copy of the closure and we must thus initialize it explicitly after the base ctor call and before

member.name: F:System.Compiler.MethodContract.validations
member.summary: Used to support legacy if-then-throw and validator calls as contracts. Only used by rewriter. The decompiled validations appear as Requires<E> on the requires list. This list contains RequiresOtherwise and ordinary Requires in the proper order.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.MethodContract.Validations
member.summary: Contains the original requires contracts, including validations. Validations are not expanded as in the Requires list. This list is used in the rewriter to emit code that uses the original validation instructions rather than Requires(E)

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Invariant
member.summary: This is a method, as we need a binding for "this".

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Method.ProvideMethodAttributes
member.summary: A delegate that is called the first time Attributes is accessed, if non-null. Provides for incremental construction of the type node. Must not leave Attributes null.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.Contract
member.summary: The preconditions, postconditions, and modifies clauses of this method.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Contains declarative security information associated with the type.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.ImplicitlyImplementedInterfaceMethods
member.summary: Computes the implicitly implemented methods for any method, not necessarily being compiled.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.ShallowImplicitlyImplementedInterfaceMethods
member.summary: Computes the implicitly implemented methods (of interfaces of this type)

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.InitLocals
member.summary: True if all local variables are to be initialized to default values before executing the method body.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if this method is a template that conforms to the rules for a CLR generic method.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters this method has to be called with.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.ReturnAttributes
member.summary: Attributes that apply to the return value of this method.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.ReturnType
member.summary: The type of value that this method may return.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.DeclaringMember
member.summary: Provides the declaring event or property of an accessor.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.Body
member.summary: The instructions constituting the body of this method, in the form of a tree.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.Instructions
member.summary: The instructions constituting the body of this method, in the form of a linear list of Instruction nodes.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if this method can in principle be overridden by a method in a derived class.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.Template
member.summary: The (generic) method template from which this method was instantiated. Null if this is not a (generic) method template instance.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Method.TemplateArguments
member.summary: The arguments used when this (generic) method template instance was instantiated.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Method.MethodAttributeProvider
member.summary: The type of delegates that fill in the Attributes property of the given method.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeContract.#ctor(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: When types get constructed via the Reader, we let the Invariants be initialized on demand. When the parser creates a type, we want the type contract to contain the empty invariant list so that it won't grovel through the attributes on first access to Invariants.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.InstanceInitializer.IsDeferringConstructor
member.summary: True if this constructor calls a constructor declared in the same class, as opposed to the base class.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.InstanceInitializer.ContainsBaseMarkerBecauseOfNonNullFields
member.summary: When the source uses the C# compatibility mode, base calls cannot be put after non-null field initialization, but must be put before the body. But the user can specify where the base ctor call should be performed by using "base;" as a marker. During parsing this flag is set so the right code transformations can be performed at code generation.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Field.Initializer
member.summary: Provides a value that is assigned to the field upon initialization.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Field.DefaultValue
member.summary: The compile-time value to be substituted for references to this field if it is a literal.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Field.IsVolatile
member.summary: True if the field may not be cached. Used for sharing data between multiple threads.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Field.Type
member.summary: The type of values that may be stored in the field.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Field.IsLiteral
member.summary: True if all references to the field are replaced with a value that is determined at compile-time.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Field.IsInitOnly
member.summary: True if the field may only be assigned to inside the constructor.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.FieldInfo
member.summary: Used to transmit info from il reader to dummy member generator

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Property.ImplementedTypes
member.summary: The list of types (just one in C#) that contain abstract or virtual properties that are explicity implemented or overridden by this property.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Property.Getter
member.summary: The method that is called to get the value of this property. Corresponds to the get clause in C#.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Property.Setter
member.summary: The method that is called to set the value of this property. Corresponds to the set clause in C#.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Property.OtherMethods
member.summary: Other methods associated with the property. No equivalent in C#.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Property.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if this property can in principle be overridden by a property in a derived class.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Property.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters of this property if it is an indexer.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Property.Type
member.summary: The type of value that this property holds.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Namespace
member.summary: A named container of types and nested namespaces. The name of the container implicitly qualifies the names of the contained types and namespaces.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Namespace.FullNameId
member.summary: The FullName of the namespace in the form of an Identifier rather than in the form of a string.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Namespace.ProvideTypes
member.summary: A delegate that is called the first time Types is accessed. Provides for incremental construction of the namespace node.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.Namespace.ProviderHandle
member.summary: Opaque information passed as a parameter to the delegate in ProvideTypes. Typically used to associate this namespace instance with a helper object.

member.name: P:System.Compiler.Namespace.Types
member.summary: The list of types contained inside this namespace. If the value of Types is null and the value of ProvideTypes is not null, the TypeProvider delegate is called to fill in the value of this property.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Namespace.TypeProvider
member.summary: A method that fills in the Types property of the given namespace. Must not leave Types null.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.TypeViewer
member.summary: An object that knows how to produce a particular scope's view of a type.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeViewer.GetTypeView(System.Compiler.TypeViewer,System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Return a scope's view of the argument type, where the scope's view is represented by a type viewer. [The identity function, except for dialects (e.g. Extensible Sing#) that allow extensions and differing views of types]. Defined as a static method to allow the type viewer to be null, meaning an identity-function view.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TypeViewer.GetTypeView(System.Compiler.TypeNode)
member.summary: Return the typeViewer's view of the argument type. Overridden by subclasses that support non-identity-function type viewers, e.g. Extensible Sing#.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Pdb.ILocalScope.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the first operation in the scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Pdb.ILocalScope.Length
member.summary: The length of the scope. Offset+Length equals the offset of the first operation outside the scope, or equals the method body length.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.Pdb.ILocalScope.MethodDefinition
member.summary: The definition of the method in which this local scope is defined.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Metadata.SynchronizedWeakDictionary
member.summary: A thin wrapper for a synchronized System.Collections.Hashtable that inserts and strips WeakReference wrappers for the values stored in the table.

member.name: T:System.Compiler.Specializer
member.summary: This class specializes a normalized IR by replacing type parameters with type arguments.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Specializer.VisitMethod(System.Compiler.Method)
member.summary:
Called in 2 circumstances 1. Specializing a method because the parent type is instantiated. In this case, the method template parameters if any, are not yet copied and need to be copied while keeping sharing alive. The copy is necessary when the type parameter has interface constraints or base type constraints that are being changed due to instantiation.
2. Specializing when we instantiate a generic method itself. In this case, the template parameter list of the method is null, so no template parameter copying is done (or necessary).

member.name: M:System.Compiler.Specializer.FreshTypeParameterListIfNecessary(System.Compiler.TypeNodeList)
member.summary: Assumes the list itself was cloned by the duplicator.

member.name: F:System.Compiler.SystemAssemblyLocation.SystemAssemblyCache
member.summary: Allows compilers to share an assembly cache for loading runtime and system dlls.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TargetPlatform.SetToPostV2(System.String)
member.summary: Use this to set the target platform to a platform with a superset of the platform assemblies in version 2.0, but where the public key tokens and versions numbers are determined by reading in the actual assemblies from the supplied location. Only assemblies recognized as platform assemblies in version 2.0 will be unified.

member.name: M:System.Compiler.TargetPlatform.SetToPostV1_1(System.String)
member.summary: Use this to set the target platform to a platform with a superset of the platform assemblies in version 1.1, but where the public key tokens and versions numbers are determined by reading in the actual assemblies from the supplied location. Only assemblies recognized as platform assemblies in version 1.1 will be unified.
